labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Exa Search" is primarily focused on web-based research, search, and information extraction. It offers a suite of specialized tools for performing real-time web searches, academic research, company analysis, crawler operations, competitor findings, professional networking, and code repository searches. The core functionality revolves around gathering, analyzing, and retrieving structured and unstructured data from the web efficiently.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server's main tools are centered around searching and retrieving information from the web, including real-time searches, academic research, and professional data extraction. The secondary label "Browser Automation" is relevant due to the crawling capabilities for extracting content from specific URLs. The secondary label "Database Operations" is included because the tools enable the retrieval of structured information that can be used similarly to database queries.

tools.name: web_search_exa
tools.description: Search the web using Exa AI - performs real-time web searches and can scrape content from specific URLs. Supports configurable result counts and returns the content from the most relevant websites.

numResults.description: Number of search results to return (default: 5)

tools.name: research_paper_search_exa
tools.description: Search for academic papers and research using Exa AI - specializes in finding scholarly articles, research papers, and academic content. Returns detailed information about research findings and academic sources.

numResults.description: Number of research papers to return (default: 5)

tools.name: company_research_exa
tools.description: Research companies using Exa AI - finds comprehensive information about businesses, organizations, and corporations. Provides insights into company operations, news, financial information, and industry analysis.

companyName.description: Name of the company to research

numResults.description: Number of search results to return (default: 5)

tools.name: crawling_exa
tools.description: Extract and crawl content from specific URLs using Exa AI - retrieves full text content, metadata, and structured information from web pages. Ideal for extracting detailed content from known URLs.

url.description: URL to crawl and extract content from

tools.name: competitor_finder_exa
tools.description: Find competitors for a business using Exa AI - identifies similar companies, competitive landscape analysis, and market positioning. Helps discover direct and indirect competitors in any industry.

companyName.description: Name of the company to find competitors for

tools.name: linkedin_search_exa
tools.description: Search LinkedIn profiles and companies using Exa AI - finds professional profiles, company pages, and business-related content on LinkedIn. Useful for networking, recruitment, and business research.

query.description: LinkedIn search query (e.g., person name, company, job title)

searchType.description: Type of LinkedIn content to search (default: all)

numResults.description: Number of LinkedIn results to return (default: 5)

tools.name: wikipedia_search_exa
tools.description: Search Wikipedia articles using Exa AI - finds comprehensive, factual information from Wikipedia entries. Ideal for research, fact-checking, and getting authoritative information on various topics.

query.description: Wikipedia search query (topic, person, place, concept, etc.)

numResults.description: Number of Wikipedia articles to return (default: 5)

tools.name: github_search_exa
tools.description: Search GitHub repositories and code using Exa AI - finds repositories, code snippets, documentation, and developer profiles on GitHub. Useful for finding open source projects, code examples, and technical resources.

query.description: GitHub search query (repository name, programming language, username, etc.)

searchType.description: Type of GitHub content to search (default: all)

numResults.description: Number of GitHub results to return (default: 5)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "debug": false
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/exa/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
